code: @Manual{,   title = {kunstomverse: Easily Install and Load Select Packages},   author = {Joshua Kunst},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.0.1},   url = {http://jkunst.com/kunstomverse/}, }

what: Easily Install and Load Select Packages
title: Easily Install and Load Select Packages
text: goal kunstomverse custom tidyverse package among things: Load missing packages tidyverse don’t load: scales, lubridate, broom. Install via suggests packages custom functions like theme_knst

title: Easily Install and Load Select Packages
text: packages load: can install extra packages using::
code: pkgs #>  [1] "purrr"     "ggplot2"   "dplyr"     "tibble"    "tidyr"     "stringr"   #>  [7] "readr"     "forcats"   "magrittr"  "lubridate" "scales"    "broom" # install.packages(kunstomverse:::EXTRAPACKAGES) kunstomverse:::EXTRAPACKAGES #>  [1] "odbc"           "readxl"         "writexl"        "dbplyr"         #>  [5] "rvest"          "devtools"       "testthat"       "roxygen2"       #>  [9] "assertthat"     "forecast"       "randomForest"   "partykit"       #> [13] "ranger"         "shiny"          "shinydashboard" "shinythemes"    #> [17] "flexdashboard"  "knitr"          "rmarkdown"      "xaringan"       #> [21] "revealjs"       "distill"        "highcharter"    "DT"             #> [25] "leaflet"        "ggrepel"        "patchwork"      "ggforce"        #> [29] "extrafont"      "fs"             "desc"           "reprex"         #> [33] "furrr"          "santoku"

title: Easily Install and Load Select Packages
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("jbkunst/kunstomverse") install.packages(kunstomverse:::EXTRAPACKAGES)

what: A function to applied some forcats functions — fct_clean
title: A function to applied some forcats functions — fct_clean
text: function applied forcats functions

title: A function to applied some forcats functions — fct_clean
code: fct_clean(   x,   na_level = "(Missing)",   n = NULL,   other_level = "Other",   infreq = TRUE )

title: A function to applied some forcats functions — fct_clean
text: x vector na_level argument null, `fct_explicit_na` applied argument. n argument null, `fct_lump_n` applied `n` `other_level`. other_level argument used `n` null. infreq Logical value apply `fct_infreq`.

title: A function to applied some forcats functions — fct_clean
code: x1 <- c(rep(LETTERS[1:9], times = c(10, 40, 5, 27, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1)), rep(NA, 10)) x2 <- factor(x1)  table(x1, useNA = "always") #> x1 #>    A    B    C    D    E    F    G    H    I <NA>  #>   10   40    5   27    1    1    1    1    1   10  table(x2, useNA = "always") #> x2 #>    A    B    C    D    E    F    G    H    I <NA>  #>   10   40    5   27    1    1    1    1    1   10   identical(fct_clean(x1), fct_clean(x2)) #> [1] TRUE  xf <- fct_clean(x1, n = 4) xf #>  [1] A         A         A         A         A         A         A         #>  [8] A         A         A         B         B         B         B         #> [15] B         B         B         B         B         B         B         #> [22] B         B         B         B         B         B         B         #> [29] B         B         B         B         B         B         B         #> [36] B         B         B         B         B         B         B         #> [43] B         B         B         B         B         B         B         #> [50] B         Other     Other     Other     Other     Other     D         #> [57] D         D         D         D         D         D         D         #> [64] D         D         D         D         D         D         D         #> [71] D         D         D         D         D         D         D         #> [78] D         D         D         D         D         Other     Other     #> [85] Other     Other     Other     (Missing) (Missing) (Missing) (Missing) #> [92] (Missing) (Missing) (Missing) (Missing) (Missing) (Missing) #> Levels: B D A (Missing) Other  table(xf, useNA = "always") #> xf #>         B         D         A (Missing)     Other      <NA>  #>        40        27        10        10        10         0

code: f <- factor(c("b", "b", "a", "c", "c", "c"))  fct_to_excel_values(f) #> [1] 2) b 2) b 1) a 3) c 3) c 3) c #> Levels: 1) a 2) b 3) c

what: A box and whiskers plot (in the style of Tukey) — geom_boxplot2
title: A box and whiskers plot (in the style of Tukey) — geom_boxplot2
text: credits @kongdd https://github.com/rpkgs/Ipaper

title: A box and whiskers plot (in the style of Tukey) — geom_boxplot2
code: geom_boxplot2(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   stat = "boxplot",   position = "dodge2",   ...,   outlier.colour = NULL,   outlier.color = NULL,   outlier.fill = NULL,   outlier.shape = 19,   outlier.size = 1.5,   outlier.stroke = 0.5,   outlier.alpha = NULL,   show.errorbar = TRUE,   width.errorbar = 0.7,   notch = FALSE,   notchwidth = 0.5,   varwidth = FALSE,   na.rm = FALSE,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE )

title: A box and whiskers plot (in the style of Tukey) — geom_boxplot2
text: mapping mapping data data stat stat position position ... ... outlier.colour outlier.colour outlier.color outlier.color outlier.fill outlier.fill outlier.shape outlier.shape outlier.size outlier.size outlier.stroke outlier.stroke outlier.alpha outlier.alpha show.errorbar boolean width.errorbar width errorbar. notch `FALSE` (default) make standard box plot. `TRUE`, make notched box plot. Notches used compare groups; notches two boxes overlap, suggests medians significantly different. notchwidth notched box plot, width notch relative body (defaults `notchwidth = 0.5`). varwidth `FALSE` (default) make standard box plot. `TRUE`, boxes drawn widths proportional square-roots number observations groups (possibly weighted, using `weight` aesthetic). na.rm na.rm show.legend show.legend inherit.aes inherit.aes

title: A box and whiskers plot (in the style of Tukey) — geom_boxplot2
code: df <- data.frame(   x = sample(LETTERS[1:3], prob = 1:3, size = 1000, replace = TRUE),   y = rgamma(1000, shape = 1) )  df <- data.frame(   x = sample(LETTERS[1:3], prob = 1:3, size = 1000, replace = TRUE),   y = rt(1000, df = 3) )  ggplot(df) +   geom_boxplot(aes(x, y))   ggplot(df) +   geom_boxplot2(aes(x, y))   ggplot(df) +   geom_boxplot2(aes(x, y), width.errorbar = 0.2, width = 0.25)

title: Geom point/jitter with shape 21 and color white — geom_point2
code: geom_point2(..., shape = 21, color = "white")  geom_jitter2(..., shape = 21, color = "white")

title: Geom point/jitter with shape 21 and color white — geom_point2
text: ... geom_point/geom_jitter parameters. shape Shape 21 color Color "white"

title: Geom point/jitter with shape 21 and color white — geom_point2
code: ggplot(iris) +   geom_jitter(aes(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, color = Species))   ggplot(iris) +   geom_jitter2(aes(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, fill = Species))   ggplot(iris) +   geom_point(aes(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, color = Species))   ggplot(iris) +   geom_point2(aes(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, fill = Species))

what: Conflicts between the kunstomverse and other packages — kunstomverse_conflicts
title: Conflicts between the kunstomverse and other packages — kunstomverse_conflicts
text: function lists conflicts packages kunstomverse packages loaded.

title: Conflicts between the kunstomverse and other packages — kunstomverse_conflicts
code: kunstomverse_conflicts()

title: Conflicts between the kunstomverse and other packages — kunstomverse_conflicts
text: dplyr one select packages, following four conflicts deliberately ignored: intersect, union, setequal, setdiff dplyr. functions make base equivalents generic, negatively affect existing code.

title: Conflicts between the kunstomverse and other packages — kunstomverse_conflicts
code: kunstomverse_conflicts() #> ── Conflicts ─────────────────────────────────────── kunstomverse_conflicts() ── #> ✖ lubridate::as.difftime() masks base::as.difftime() #> ✖ scales::col_factor()     masks readr::col_factor() #> ✖ lubridate::date()        masks base::date() #> ✖ scales::discard()        masks purrr::discard() #> ✖ magrittr::extract()      masks tidyr::extract() #> ✖ dplyr::filter()          masks stats::filter() #> ✖ lubridate::intersect()   masks base::intersect() #> ✖ dplyr::lag()             masks stats::lag() #> ✖ magrittr::set_names()    masks purrr::set_names() #> ✖ lubridate::setdiff()     masks base::setdiff() #> ✖ lubridate::union()       masks base::union()

title: Wrapper of `Sys.sleep()` using  `progress` package — progress_sleep
text: Wrapper `Sys.sleep()` using  `progress` package

title: Wrapper of `Sys.sleep()` using  `progress` package — progress_sleep
code: progress_sleep(time, format = " waiting [:bar] :percent eta: :eta", ...)

title: Wrapper of `Sys.sleep()` using  `progress` package — progress_sleep
text: time time interval suspend execution , seconds. format format progress bar. number tokens can  used , see . defaults "[:bar] :percent", means  progress bar within brackets left, percentage  printed right. Source: progress package. ... Parameters progress::progress_bar$new

title: Wrapper of `Sys.sleep()` using  `progress` package — progress_sleep
code: progress_sleep(5)  system.time(progress_sleep(10)) #>    user  system elapsed  #>   0.003   0.000  11.015

what: My ggplot2 go-to theme inspired by hrbrthemes — theme_knst
title: My ggplot2 go-to theme inspired by hrbrthemes — theme_knst
text: ggplot2 go-theme inspired hrbrthemes

title: My ggplot2 go-to theme inspired by hrbrthemes — theme_knst
code: theme_knst(   ...,   base_size = 10,   plot_margin = ggplot2::margin(10, 10, 10, 10),   axis_title_size = 10,   grid_col = "grey80" )  theme_knst_calibri(..., plot_title_face = "plain")  theme_knst_segoe(..., plot_title_face = "plain")

title: My ggplot2 go-to theme inspired by hrbrthemes — theme_knst
text: ... Parameters hrbrthemes::theme_ipsum base_size 10 plot_margin ggplot2::margin(10, 10, 10, 10) axis_title_size 10 grid_col "grey80" plot_title_face plot_title_face

title: My ggplot2 go-to theme inspired by hrbrthemes — theme_knst
code: if (FALSE) {  library(ggplot2) library(extrafont) library(hrbrthemes)  p <- ggplot(mtcars) +    geom_point(aes(mpg, hp, color = factor(carb)), size = 2.5) +    hrbrthemes::scale_color_ipsum(name = "Carb") +    labs(      x = "Fuel effiiency (mpg)", y="Weight (tons)",      title = "Seminal ggplot2 scatterplot example",      subtitle = "A plot that is only useful for demonstration purposes",      caption = "Brought to you by the letter 'g'"      ) +  theme_knst()  p  pp <- p + facet_wrap(vars(factor(carb)))  pp + theme_knst(base_family = "Calibri")  pp + theme_knst_segoe() pp + theme_knst_calibri(base_size = 15, axis_title_size = 15)  pp +   theme_knst(     base_family = "Calibri Light",     plot_title_family = "Calibri"    )  }

title: tic toc Wrappers — tik
text: tic toc Wrappers

title: tic toc Wrappers — tik
code: tik(msg = NULL, quiet = FALSE, func.tik = tik_msg)  tok(log = TRUE, func.tok = tok_msg)  tiktok_clear()  tik_msg(tik, msg = NULL)  tok_msg(tik, tok, msg, info)  tiktok_log()

title: tic toc Wrappers — tik
text: msg msg quiet quiet func.tik func.tik log log func.tok func.tok tik tik tok tok info info

title: tic toc Wrappers — tik
code: tiktok_clear()  tik(msg = "Go to sleep") #> Go to sleep - starting at: 19:45:30  Sys.sleep(2)  tok() #> Go to sleep - finished in: 2 seconds  tik(msg = "Go to sleep again!") #> Go to sleep again! - starting at: 19:45:32  Sys.sleep(1)  tok() #> Go to sleep again! - finished in: 1 seconds  tiktok_log() #> # A tibble: 2 × 5 #>     tic   toc msg                time_seconds time_minutes #>   <dbl> <dbl> <chr>                     <dbl>        <dbl> #> 1  30.8  32.8 Go to sleep                2.00       0.0334 #> 2  32.8  33.8 Go to sleep again!         1.01       0.0168
